Comparing a monument at Machupicchu to the nearby Waynapicchu and Machupicchu peaks, given near precise  datums, the margin of error would be nearer five parts in two thousand, or one part in four hundred. The intra-site results in the KML file are in a separate folder due to the lessor geodetic scale and correlated lower confidence in results.  Given the correlation between larger scale and much greater confidence in the results, I prefer researching regional and global monument relationships and geodetic properties such as latitude.
